channel.title: Switching To Linux...Maybe?
channel.description:
I've heard good things from it, so I'm thinking about partitioning my HD.
I'm pretty new to all of Linux, so is there any certain one you think I should get? How hard is Linux to run? Are there are 'specials' that comes with it?
<3

item.title: Switching To Linux...Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @para para`
item.description:
@para wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:4, topic:90437”][quote author=Original Daniel link=topic=132055.msg1277945#msg1277945 date=1178507663]
^^ Whats the difference between Kubuntu and Ubuntu?
[/quote]

Ubuntu’s main desktop system is GNOME, Kubuntu’s is KDE, KDE looks much better than GNOME and is easier to get used to,[/quote]
I wouldn’t say that if I were you, you might anger someone.
As for me, I am a big fan of GNOME…

Read full topic

item.title: Switching To Linux...Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @MybBob MybBob
item.description:
@MybBob wrote:

Sorry, wasn’t sure about the Kubuntu distro

Read full topic

item.title: Switching To Linux...Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“MybBob”]I use Xubuntu, it’s simple enough and pretty sweet for me;

MOST distro’s have;

Firefox
A messenging service, the *ubuntu range uses GAIM
Package installers,
*Ubuntu’s have GIMP

The difficulty of linux isn’t that bad if your using a *Ubuntu either, it’s all straight forward, in some cases like windows; it just has a different layout and when installing some files and such you may need to use the terminal, but one gets used to that very quickly.
Wireless is another thing, I have it and when I go on my laptop on linux I[/quote]

Actually, Kubuntu comes with Konqueror as the default browser and Kopete as the messaging service.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching To Linux...Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @MybBob MybBob
item.description:
@MybBob wrote:

I use Xubuntu, it’s simple enough and pretty sweet for me;

MOST distro’s have;

Firefox
A messenging service, the *ubuntu range uses GAIM
Package installers,
*Ubuntu’s have GIMP

The difficulty of linux isn’t that bad if your using a *Ubuntu either, it’s all straight forward, in some cases like windows; it just has a different layout and when installing some files and such you may need to use the terminal, but one gets used to that very quickly.
Wireless is another thing, I have it and when I go on my laptop on linux I just can’t be botherd with the thought of wirelss, never have been, so I just unplug the ethernet from my main computer, although as mopar stated ndiswrapper is supposedly very simple and effective when setting up wireless on linux, if needed I can provide some links to tutorials if you specify your card model.

Any off the *Ubuntu ranges are good for someone with any level of knowledge that is to do with Linux, some people argue that some of the more simple distro’s may be better though, I personally tried using Puppy Linux before my swap over, this is only around 80mb and is a fairly stable and nice distro to use.

~MybBob

Read full topic

item.title: Switching To Linux...Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Unless you have a good wireless card that has native linux drivers getting your internet to work may be tricky Mr.Chris, you can use windows drivers with a handy program called ndiswrapper, it just takes a little work.

I do have a pretty sexy wireless card, but looks like it wont be able to work on Linux, so I guess I will have to use ndiswrapper. Thanks for letting me know

[quote=“lothy, post:6, topic:90437”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=132055.msg1278504#msg1278504 date=1178512190]
Ok, I have a pretty good idea. I’m going to install Kubuntu on this crappy laptop, and see what I think of it. I’ll let you know how it goes.[br][size=1]Posted on: 06-05-2007, 22:23:14[/size][hr]Question - How hard is the installation?
[/quote]
You put the live CD in, and restart your computer. :rolleyes:[/quote]

Haha, thanks lothy

Read full topic

item.title: Switching To Linux...Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Unless you have a good wireless card that has native linux drivers getting your internet to work may be tricky Mr.Chris, you can use windows drivers with a handy program called ndiswrapper, it just takes a little work.
